Hint:
$HasPermanents
Effect: Allow for the player's name or arguments to be used in a conversation. This typically goes at the top of the script before anything else.

$ConversationType(type: u8)
Effect: Change the display type used for the conversation. 0 is typically used for battle conversations. 1 is for conversations with full busts like supports and most cutscenes.

$LoadAssets(character: String)
Effect: Add a new speaker to the conversation. After this command, you should use the $Reposition command to place them in the scene. The speaker name is determined by the name value in the "Portraits / FaceData" module. If you need to use different portraits with the same name, add a portrait override to "Modules/ServiceData/FE14PortraitOverrides.json".

$SetSpeaker(character: String)
Effect: Change the active speaker. This determines whose portrait is highlighted and who shows up on the name plate for the next message.

$Emotions(standard: String, blush: String, sweat: String)
Effect: Apply all emotions between the parentheses to the active speaker. Emotions are translated from Japanese. If a translation does not exist, Paragon will display the untranslated text. If you want to change an emotion's translation or add new translations, modify "Modules/ServiceData/FE14EmotionTranslations.json".

$PlayVoice(voice: String)
Effect: Play the given voice line.

$PlaySoundEffect(sound_effect: String)
Effect: Play the given sound effect.

$PlayMusic(sound_effect: String, timer: u32)
Effect: Play the given music after the given number of milliseconds.

$StopMusic(timer: u32)
Effect: Stop any playing after after the given number of milliseconds.

$Alias(custom_name: String)
Effect: Give the active speaker a different display name.

$Pause
Effect: Wait for a button press before continuing.

$Clear
Effect: Clear the textbox. This is equivalent to $p in the game script.

$DeleteSpeaker
Effect: Remove the active speaker from the scene.

$Panicked
Effect: Change the textbox graphic to a panicked variant.

$Scrolling
Effect: Change the animation for textbox changes.

$Wait(timer: u32)
Effect: Wait the given number of milliseconds before proceeding.

$Volume(music_volume: u32, timer: u32)
Effect: Change the music volume to the given number after the given number of milliseconds.

$Dramatic(volume: u32)
Effect: Still being researched. Appears to stop the music and play a dramatic noise at the given volume.

$OverridePortrait(portrait: String)
Effect: Replace the active speaker's portraits with something else.

$ShowMarriageScene(marriage_scene: String)
Effect: Play the given Live2D scene. Used for the marriage scene in avatar S supports.

$Ramp(music: String, timer: u32)
Effect: Play the given music starting at a low volume. Increase the volume to full over the given number of milliseconds.

$StopRamp(music: String, timer: u32)
Effect: Stop a running ramp for the given music after the given number of milliseconds.

$SetRampVolume(music: String, volume: u32, timer: u32)
Effect: Change the running ramp for the given music to a new volume after the given number of milliseconds.

$FadeIn(timer: u32)
Effect: Fade in over the given number of milliseconds.

$FadeOut(timer: u32)
Effect: Fade to black over the given number of milliseconds.

$FadeWhite(timer: u32)
Effect: Fade to white over the given number of milliseconds.

$Nu
Effect: Show the avatar's name in the textbox.

$G(male_text: String, female_text: String)
Effect: Show different text in the textbox depending on the avatar's gender.

$arg(value: T)
Effect: Show the value of the given argument in the textbox. Used to print numbers and text from CMB scripts.
